page.title: 06Niton Undercliff_Erosion
page.content: The massive land movements which formed(and still shape)the Undercliff seem to have begun at the end of the last Ice Age.The area from Blackgang to St.Lawrence is unluckily just about the most unstable part of it and very large landslips have occurred up to the present time.The main cause of these slips is always the water- logging of the topsoil overlying the impermeable gault clay (blue slipper) by springs rising at the foot of the of the inland cliff.In very wet seasons the land eventually cannot hold the weight of the water and slips from the cliff towards the sea.The recent destructive slip at Blackgang shows only too well how the movement starts near the cliff.The erosion of Chale Terrace at the present time shows the commencement of a new chine.
